intro: Sarcoglottis pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered sarcoglottis, is a member of the Cyclanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sarcoglottis pauciflora is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
